newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish bonds dip at start, outlook promising.
newsitem.headline: Danish bonds dip at start, outlook promising.

text.p: Danish bond prices dipped slightly in early trade on Monday despite Friday's Wall Street rises but dealers said the market undertone was positive.
"The market mood is still very optimistic, the 10-year bund differential should narrow," one dealer said.

The benchmark eight percent state bond due 2006 was 0.05 down from Friday's close at 114.04, yielding 5.87 percent while the forthcoming seven percent 2007 tone-setter was down by the same margin at 106.82, with yield at 6.08 percent. The 2007's 10-year yield gap with Germany widened one point to 55.

The 2007's 10-year yield gap with Germany widened one basis point to 55. The crown stood at 3.8088 per mark at 0725 GMT, firming from Friday's 3.8095. --Chris Follett, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33-969652
